src:
Himki pokazao moć u malom ruskom derbiju u Evroligi, Šved i Buker prelomili rafalima
Zenit i dalje čeka prvu pobedu u Evroligi na domaćem terenu

07 Nov 2019

CSKA je neprikosnoveni vladar ruske košarke, ali se ove sezone vodi bitka i za “ruski broj 2” u Evroligi. Zenit se ipak pokazao kao nedostojan izazivač Himkiju i večeras je doživeo novi poraz u Evroligi. Tim iz Podmoskovlja je slavio 87:73 u Sankt Peterburgu i nastavio sa osličnim rezultatima.
Himkiju je ovo bila peta pobeda u sedam utakmica, na pravi način su odgovorili posle poraza u Beogradu, dok Zenit ostaje na one dve pobede posle produžetaka nad Olimpijakosom i Žalgirisom u gostima. Domaći parket i dalje ostaje uklet za debitanta u Evroligi.
Zenit je bolje otvorio meč i vodio u većem delu prve četvrtine kada je Ajon dominirao pod košem, a Ostin Holins rešetao sa distance i ubacio 13 poena. Međutim, Buker i Šved su održavali Himki u igri i izborili izjednačenje na kraju kvartala. Jonas Jerebko je sa devet vezanih poena otvorio drugu četvrtinu i doneo vođstvo Himkiju, da bi potom u seriju ušao Aleksej Šved i sa deset minuta poslednjih pet poena doneo gostima vođstvo od 12 poena razlike.
Zenit je uhvatio priključak u trećoj četvrtini preko Ajona, Albisija i Holinsa, prišao i na samo dva poena razlike, ali nije uspeo da preokrene. Devin Buker se razoropadio u poslednjoj četvrtini i odveo Himki na nedostižnih 15 poena prednosti.
Gosti su trojke šutirali odličnih 43 odsto (12/28), bili bolji u skoku (33:27), imali više asistencija (24:19) i u svim segmentima nadigrali Zenit kod kojih je Holins zakazao u završnici. Buker je sa 20 poena bio najefikasniji u pobedničkom timu. Za dva poena je šutirao 7/11, a za tri 2/3. Šved je isporučio svoju porciju sa 19 poena uz nešto slabiji procenat trojki (3/9), a Stefan Jović je meč završio sa skromnih pet poena, tri asistencije i četiri ukradene lopte. Kod Zenita je najefikasniji bio Holins sa 25 poena, ali ga je na kraju izdao šut za tri poena - 5/14.

EVROLIGA - 7. KOLO:


Četvrtak

Zenit - Himki 73:87/Holins 25 - Buker 20/

19.00: Crvena zvezda - Real Madrid 20.00: Olimpijakos - Efes 20.05: Makabi - Alba20.45:  (1,70) Olimpija Milano (14,50)  Baskonija (2,30)

text:
Khimki showed power in a small Russian Euroleague derby, Swedes and Booker bursting with bursts
Zenit are still waiting for their first Euroleague victory at home

07 Nov 2019

CSKA is the undisputed ruler of Russian basketball, but this season there is also a battle for the "Russian number 2" in the Euroleague. Zenit, however, proved to be an unworthy challenger to the Khimki and suffered a new defeat in the Euroleague tonight. The team from Podmoskovlje celebrated 87:73 in St. Petersburg and continued with different results.
Khimki was their fifth victory in seven games, they answered correctly after their defeat in Belgrade, while Zenit remain in those two wins after extra time over Olympiakos and Zalgiris away. Home parquet remains haunted for its Euroleague debut.
Zenit opened the match better and led for much of the first quarter when Ajon dominated the basket with Austin Hollins clearing the distance and scoring 13 points. However, Booker and Sweden kept the Khimki in the game and won the tie at the end of the quarter. With nine tied points, Jonas Jerebko opened the second quarter and led the Khimki, then Alexey Shved entered the series and, with ten minutes in the last five points, gave the guests a 12 point lead.
Zenit grabbed a third-quarter hook over Aion, Albis and Hollins, coming in with just two points difference, but failed to reverse. Devin Booker broke free in the final quarter and led the Khimki to an unachievable 15 point lead.
The guests shot a perfect 43 percent (12/28), were better in the jump (33:27), had more assists (24:19) and outplayed Zenit in all segments, with Hollins scheduled in the final. Booker was the most efficient on the winning team with 20 points. He shot 7/11 for two points and 2/3 for three. The Swede delivered his 19-point portion with a slightly poorer three-point percentage (3/9), and Stefan Jovic finished the game with a modest five points, three assists and four steals. At Zenit, Hollins was the most efficient with 25 points, but was eventually issued by a three point shot - 5/14.

EUROLEAGUE - ROUND 7


Thursday

Zenit - Khimki 73: 87 / Hollins 25 - Booker 20 /
